Description: Leather sandal for the left foot. Sole complete, of three thicknesses, lowest largely worn away, some wear damage to middle sole. Soles joined with leather stitching around the edge and across the sole. Towards the front of the sole a hole to accept a tie to run between the big and adjacent toe. Towards the rear one side of the tie remains, a leather disc with thong running up from it. Upper surface of sole decorated with a lattice pattern and with a border of guilloche.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Crypt K2 14 fill
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
